messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Nursing
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/9/2007 12:45:53 A.M. Eastern Standard Time, unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes: It s  appropriate and right for many people all over
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/9/2007 12:45:53 A.M. Eastern Standard Time,
unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes:

It's appropriate and right for many
people all over the world. Lots and lots of kids are still nursing at
three years old and I know some who nursed until six or seven.<<<<<<<

My oldest nursed until the day before he turned 5 years old, and my youngest
nursed until one month before he turned 8 years old. Neither one of them
stopped for any amount of time and then wanted to go back, so I can't answer as
to how I would feel. I can say I think it would be OK with me. I have
heard of children wanting that when they were tired or sick or in a new
environment etc, for comfort.

Just my experience,
Pam G






[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
